newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: CRICKET-NEW ZEALAND WIN TOSS, BAT V ENGLAND.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-NEW ZEALAND WIN TOSS, BAT V ENGLAND.

text.p: New Zealand won the toss and
chose to bat in the fifth and final one-day cricket
international against England at the Basin Reserve on Tuesday.
John Crawley returned to the English side in place of the
injured Nick Knight, and Jack Russell replaced Ronnie Irani for
his first match of the one-day series.
New Zealand omitted Simon Doull in favour of spinner Dipak
New Zealand: Lee Germon (captain), Bryan Young, Nathan
Astle, Stephen Fleming, Chris Cairns, Adam Parore, Chris Harris,
Dipak Patel, Gavin Larsen, Heath Davis, Geoff Allott.
England: Mike Atherton (captain), Alec Stewart, Graham
Thorpe, Nasser Hussain, John Crawley, Craig White, Robert Croft,
Darren Gough, Andrew Caddick, Chris Silverwood, Jack Russell.
